messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Laura D
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/19/2003 9:24:47 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... The general Frustration over the Glena situation and a couple others. It was a moment last
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/19/2003 9:24:47 AM Eastern Standard Time,
britcontoo@... writes:

> What do you find so upsetting? The tone of Tory's post or the
> general frustration with Glenna? I do not find that clear in this
> post.
>
> Olga :)

The general Frustration over the Glena situation and a couple others.
It was a moment last night after a long weekend of reading posts and it all
just was eating away at my positive thinking.

I said it and I feel better. I was grouchy all weekend I let it all weigh on
my mind. Today is another day and I would like to see the list go back to the
way it was between the two Glena posts.

Laura D


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Laura D
messages.msgSnippet: Laura, That was a bit harsh.  Certainly in the same *harsh* tone that got some people upset with Sandra.  Glenna is back and she can certainly defend herself.
messages.messageBody:
Laura,
That was a bit harsh. Certainly in the same *harsh* tone that got
some people upset with Sandra. Glenna is back and she can certainly
defend herself. I understand your point, however Glenna is not
making any new comments. Her defenses are the same lines that can be
found in the archives. If you are not making any new points, then
there is no reason to post. Maybe, Tory's comment was sarcastic and
unnecessary but in all honestly yours stuck out far more to me.

What do you find so upsetting? The tone of Tory's post or the
general frustration with Glenna? I do not find that clear in this
post.

Olga :)

messages.subject: Laura D
messages.msgSnippet: ... post! When someone says they are done with it and they are not going to post anymore about it, then yes, I expect her not to post about it. ... Because I
messages.messageBody:
>MY F- ING )))))))) WORD!

>The list goes on all weekend about HER and you expect her not to
post!

When someone says they are done with it and they are not going to
post anymore about it, then yes, I expect her not to post about it.


> YOU TORY posted MANY times why the hell didn't you stop??????????

Because I never said I was going to stop. (Until my last post to
Glena, in which I said I would stop posting to her. And I have.)

>Get off your horse, say something other than running behind someone
else's
>words and get over it for cry-n out loud.

Sounds like you have a lot to get over yourself. Last time I
checked, I am allowed to post my thoughts on this board. I am not
sure what you mean about running behind someone else's words.

>Several posts that I read and some I wrote where NOT just about
>Glena it was
an overall feeling about more than just her posts. Im glad she is
>back all
>the talking this weekend should have ended while she was gone and it
didn't.

If you read my next post, I stated exactly the fact that discussion
had moved on. I do not have a problem with Glena posting. It was
that she came back into a discussion she said she was leaving, and
said the same things she had already said again and
again.

>Maybe you should go away for a weekend we will all blast you in a
hundred or
>so emails and you try to zip it!

Although it seems I have frustrated you quite a bit, I don't think I
have said anything on this board that would frustrate the number of
people Glena did. If I were to do so, then that might happen. If I
had found myself under the initial attack that Glena found herself, I
would have stopped posting MUCH earlier to determine what the hell I
was doing that was pissing so many people off.


>Clear enough, I dont think this is hard to understand is it!

>Laura D

I clearly understand you don't like my posts. Unfortunately I don't
use you as a measuring stick.
